title: How to symbolize the statement “for no $x$, not $p(x) $' (logic, predicate logic, quantifiers, math) - Quora

response.answer_text: I think the intention of the statement is “there is no xx for which not p(x)p(x)", which is symbolically ¬∃x.¬p(x)¬∃x.¬p(x), which is equivalent to ∀x.¬¬p(x)∀x.¬¬p(x), which with double negation is equivalent to ∀x.p(x)∀x.p(x) (though there are reasonable circumstances in which double negation might not be allowed).
